32.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
32.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

32.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
32.str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.

32.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
32.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
Really, truly, actually. Adverb of the oblique cases of on; really.

32.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
32.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

33.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
33.str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

33.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural

33.str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

33.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
33.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

33.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
33.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

33.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
33.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

33.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
33.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

33.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Feminine Singular
33.str2: Of what sort. From the base of pou and hoios; individualizing interrogative what sort of, or which one.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.

33.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
33.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
